ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned so much! As this was a Methods course for Urban Studies, we learned different ways of looking at, analyzing, and visually representing spaces.
Photoshop proficiency, better workflow, storyboarding! caring for myself

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course was amazing! The instructor was very flexible and allowed us a lot of creative space to explore our interests and personal styles in the context of the course. It was also a very collaborative environment, in which I felt a sense of camaraderie with all of my classmates. One suggestion I have for the class is that it could be organized better, but I think that was largely due to the online semester.

Annie is such a kind, thoughtful, and talented teacher. I was lucky to take lab this spring and learned a lot about digital design production. Annie gave us room to find out own visual language while also supporting us in exploring techniques which might feel unfamiliar to us. I think if there is a political commitment it should be made explicitsometimes conversations about race, class, and gender felt vague.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course was very flexible, often meeting fully as a group and sometimes for one-on-ones with the instructor and the Teaching Fellow. Both Annie and Jia were very understanding regarding students' capacities for work and learning during the very trying (for many reasons) semester.
Annie being kind and understanding made a world of difference.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: yes, teacher was clear with feedback and was really committed to your learning wherever your skillset was at
Lab challenges you but the improvement you will see throughout your work is kind of crazy. Annie is the best, and if she is teaching lab again it is a must take.
yes! lab can be quite fun at times. just break all the rules and do what you feels good to you and it generally will turn out okay.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
